00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Resource management for PKI resources.
00044  */
00045 
00046 #ifndef __CVMX_PKI_RESOURCES_H__
00047 #define __CVMX_PKI_RESOURCES_H__
00048 
00049 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00050 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx.h>
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00054 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00055 extern "C" {
00056 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * This function allocates/reserves a style from pool of global styles per node.
00061  * @param node   node to allocate style from.
00062  * @param style  style to allocate, if -1 it will be allocated
00063                  first available style from style resource. If index is positive
00064          number and in range, it will try to allocate specified style.
00065  * @return   style number on success, -1 on failure.
00066  */
00067 int cvmx_pki_style_alloc(int node, int style);
00068 
00069 /**
00070  * This function allocates/reserves a cluster group from per node
00071    cluster group resources.
00072  * @param node      node to allocate cluster group from.
00073    @param cl_grp    cluster group to allocate/reserve, if -1 ,
00074                         allocate any available cluster group.
00075  * @return      cluster group number or -1 on failure
00076  */
00077 int cvmx_pki_cluster_grp_alloc(int node, int cl_grp);
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * This function allocates/reserves a cluster from per node
00081    cluster resources.
00082  * @param node      node to allocate cluster group from.
00083    @param cluster_mask  mask of clusters  to allocate/reserve, if -1 ,
00084                         allocate any available clusters.
00085  * @param num_clusters  number of clusters that will be allocated
00086  */
00087 int cvmx_pki_cluster_alloc(int node, int num_clusters, uint64_t *cluster_mask);
00088 
00089 
00090 /**
00091  * This function allocates/reserves a pcam entry from node
00092  * @param node      node to allocate pcam entry from.
00093    @param index     index of pacm entry (0-191), if -1 ,
00094                         allocate any available pcam entry.
00095  * @param bank      pcam bank where to allocate/reserve pcan entry from
00096  * @param cluster_mask  mask of clusters from which pcam entry is needed.
00097  * @return      pcam entry of -1 on failure
00098  */
00099 int cvmx_pki_pcam_entry_alloc(int node, int index, int bank, uint64_t cluster_mask);
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * This function allocates/reserves QPG table entries per node.
00103  * @param node      node number.
00104  * @param base_offset   base_offset in qpg table. If -1, first available
00105             qpg base_offset will be allocated. If base_offset is positive
00106             number and in range, it will try to allocate specified base_offset.
00107    @param count     number of consecutive qpg entries to allocate. They will be consecutive
00108                         from base offset.
00109  * @return      qpg table base offset number on success, -1 on failure.
00110  */
00111 int cvmx_pki_qpg_entry_alloc(int node, int base_offset, int count);
00112 
00113 /**
00114  * This function frees a style from pool of global styles per node.
00115  * @param node   node to free style from.
00116  * @param style  style to free
00117  * @return   0 on success, -1 on failure.
00118  */
00119 int cvmx_pki_style_free(int node, int style);
00120 
00121 
00122 /**
00123  * This function frees a cluster group from per node
00124    cluster group resources.
00125  * @param node      node to free cluster group from.
00126    @param cl_grp    cluster group to free
00127  * @return      0 on success or -1 on failure
00128  */
00129 int cvmx_pki_cluster_grp_free(int node, int cl_grp);
00130 
00131 
00132 /**
00133  * This function frees QPG table entries per node.
00134  * @param node      node number.
00135  * @param base_offset   base_offset in qpg table. If -1, first available
00136  *          qpg base_offset will be allocated. If base_offset is positive
00137  *          number and in range, it will try to allocate specified base_offset.
00138  * @param count     number of consecutive qpg entries to allocate. They will be consecutive
00139  *          from base offset.
00140  * @return      qpg table base offset number on success, -1 on failure.
00141  */
00142 int cvmx_pki_qpg_entry_free(int node, int base_offset, int count);
00143 
00144 /**
00145  * This function frees  clusters  from per node
00146    clusters resources.
00147  * @param node      node to free clusters from.
00148  * @param cluster_mask  mask of clusters need freeing
00149  * @return      0 on success or -1 on failure
00150  */
00151 int cvmx_pki_cluster_free(int node, uint64_t cluster_mask);
00152 
00153 /**
00154  * This function frees a pcam entry from node
00155  * @param node      node to allocate pcam entry from.
00156    @param index     index of pacm entry (0-191) needs to be freed.
00157  * @param bank      pcam bank where to free pcam entry from
00158  * @param cluster_mask  mask of clusters from which pcam entry is freed.
00159  * @return      0 on success OR -1 on failure
00160  */
00161 int cvmx_pki_pcam_entry_free(int node, int index, int bank, uint64_t cluster_mask);
00162 
00163 /**
00164  * This function allocates/reserves a bpid from pool of global bpid per node.
00165  * @param node  node to allocate bpid from.
00166  * @param bpid  bpid  to allocate, if -1 it will be allocated
00167  *      first available boid from bpid resource. If index is positive
00168  *      number and in range, it will try to allocate specified bpid.
00169  * @return  bpid number on success,
00170  *      -1 on alloc failure.
00171  *      -2 on resource already reserved.
00172  */
00173 int cvmx_pki_bpid_alloc(int node, int bpid);
00174 
00175 /**
00176  * This function frees a bpid from pool of global bpid per node.
00177  * @param node   node to free bpid from.
00178  * @param bpid   bpid to free
00179  * @return   0 on success, -1 on failure or
00180  */
00181 int cvmx_pki_bpid_free(int node, int bpid);
00182 
00183 /**
00184  * This function frees all the PKI software resources
00185  * (clusters, styles, qpg_entry, pcam_entry etc) for the specified node
00186  */
00187 
00188 /**
00189  * This function allocates/reserves an index from pool of global MTAG-IDX per node.
00190  * @param node  node to allocate index from.
00191  * @param idx   index  to allocate, if -1 it will be allocated
00192  * @return  MTAG index number on success,
00193  *      -1 on alloc failure.
00194  *      -2 on resource already reserved.
00195  */
00196 int cvmx_pki_mtag_idx_alloc(int node, int idx);
00197 
00198 /**
00199  * This function frees an index from pool of global MTAG-IDX per node.
00200  * @param node   node to free bpid from.
00201  * @param bpid   bpid to free
00202  * @return   0 on success, -1 on failure or
00203  */
00204 int cvmx_pki_mtag_idx_free(int node, int idx);
00205 
00206 void __cvmx_pki_global_rsrc_free(int node);
00207 
00208 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00209 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00210 }
00211 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00212 #endif
00213 
00214 #endif /*  __CVM_PKI_RESOURCES_H__ */
